Soundplayer Class Reference

The soundplayer class that is built to play sounds through openal, using the echo extension. This class plays sounds by using OpenAL and ALut. It requires the Echo class and the EchoProperties class to be usable. More...

Detailed Description

The soundplayer class that is built to play sounds through openal, using the echo extension. This class plays sounds by using OpenAL and ALut. It requires the Echo class and the EchoProperties class to be usable.

Author:
Alexander Nordh

An method for starting to play a sound source after a certain time.

Parameters:
index - The index of the sound to play.
volume - The volume the sound should be played in (from 0.0 to 1.0).
delay - The time to wait before playing the sound in milliseconds.

Parameters:

volume - The volume the sound should be played in (from 0.0 to 1.0).
loop - Decides if the sound should loop or not.

float  volume,
vector< float >  boxValues,
vector< vector< float >>  boxPosition 
)

An method for starting to play a sound source followed by an echo.

Parameters:
index - The index of the sound to play.
volume - The volume the sound should be played in (from 0.0 to 1.0).
boxValues - Values of how much each object reflects the sound.
boxPositions - The positions of the objects reflecting sound.
void Soundplayer::playWithEchoIn ( int  index,
float  volume,
float  delay,
vector< float >  boxValues,
vector< vector< float >>  boxPositions 
)

An method for starting to play a sound source followed by an echo after a certain time.

Parameters:
index - The index of the sound to play.
volume - The volume the sound should be played in (from 0.0 to 1.0).
delay - The time to wait before playing the sound which is then followed by an echo.
boxValues - Values of how much each object reflects the sound.
boxPositions - The positions of the objects reflecting sound.
